headline.main: TUNISIA LINE AFIRE; Germans Strike Hard at Most Key Points, but Allies Hold Gains FRENCH PUSH AHEAD Reach Within 20 Miles of Bizerte -- Americans Also Approach Base TUNISIA LINE AFIRE AS GERMANS STRIKE

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, April 30 -- While the Germans threw powerful but futile counter-attacks at the Allies at most key points along the Tunisian front yesterday, patrols of the French Africa Corps reached the shore of Lake Achkel at a point on the northern coastal road seventeen miles west of the Bizerte naval base and then dropped back three miles to establish a position on the height of Kef Touro.
abstract: Gers strike with powerful but futile counter-attacks at Allied Tunis front key points; French reach Lake Achkel shore; establish position on Kef Touro Ht; French and US troops reptd nearing Bizerte; US troops advance along Mateur road, Lt Gen Anderson Brit 1st Army troops push to Djebel bou Aoukaz; 10 Ger tanks reptd destroyed, that area; Allied planes continue aerial activity; hardest fighting reptd between US and Ger troops at Djebel Tahent, hill 609; map

byline.original: By FRANK L. KLUCKHOHNWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
